intro: Appendicula latilabium var. latilabium, commonly known as the broad-lipped appendicula, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has evergreen foliage with elliptical, dark green leaves that are densely packed along the stems. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands or rocky slopes. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in horticultural settings.
